page.title: 05ST. MARGARETS CHURCH
page.content:
ST. Margaret's has got a mural on the west wall. The mural has been there since the twelfth century, but was only rediscovered in 1970. The church was burnt down in 1155 and rebuilt in 1215. The new building was much larger than the old.
There are 14 services a week. The congregation for a Sunday morning service does occasionally reach sixty. A majority of the congregation come from outside East Wellow. The church attracts between two to three thousand visitors a year. They come from all over the world mainly to see the family grave of Florence Nightingale, the heroine of the Crimean War.
Volunteers clean the church, tidy the graveyard and arrange the flowers.
